title: Port Zig runtime to WebAssembly (WASI)
body:
Port the Zig runtime to compile to WebAssembly so compiled Haskell programs can run in Wasm environments.

**Deliverables:**
- Compile the Zig runtime with `zig build -Dtarget=wasm32-wasi`
- Replace OS-specific calls with WASI equivalents:
  - IO: use WASI `fd_write` / `fd_read` for stdout/stdin
  - Memory: use Wasm linear memory (no `mmap`)
- Link Wasm runtime with Wasm-compiled GRIN output
- Integration test: `main = putStrLn "Hello"` runs in `wasmtime` and prints "Hello"

**Design notes:**
- Zig has first-class Wasm support — `zig build` can target `wasm32-wasi` natively
- The GC (Immix) may need adjustments for linear memory (no `mmap`, no virtual memory)
- For Phase 1 (ArenaAllocator), Wasm should work out of the box
